# UD Gheg GPS

Language: [Gheg](/aln/index.html) (code: `aln`)<br/>
Family: Indo-European, Albanian

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.11 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Christian Ebert, Artan Islamaj, Adrian Kuqi, Barbara Sonnenhauser, Paul Widmer, Magdalena Plamada.

Repository: [UD_Gheg-GPS](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Gheg-GPS)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udaln_gps213)<br />

## Description

UD Gheg Pear Stories (GPS) contains renarrations of Wallace Chafe's Pear Stories video (pearstories.org) by heritage speakers of Gheg Albanian living in Switzerland and speakers from Prishtina.




UD Gheg GPS contains 966 sentences from 64 recordings of Gheg speakers re-narrating the *Pear Stories* video. Data collection was part of a bigger project that took place from May 2019 to July 2022 in Zurich, Prishtina and Munich. Only recordings from Prishtina und Zurich were included in the treebank. Speakers of three different generations were interviewed, age ranging from 10 to 67. Sentence ids contain information on location (`P` for Prishtina, `Z` for Zurich), Generation (`G1`, `G2`, `G3`) and a unique speaker id, all separated by hyphens, followed by an underscore and the sentence id, which starts at 1 for each interview. Due to the multilingual setting, the treebank contains many instances of code-switching (mostly Swiss-German). It also exhibits characteristics of (semi-)spontaneous speech, like disfluencies and corrections.

The treebank contains 16k tokens and was not split into training and test set.

## Acknowledgments

- Barbara Sonnenhauser, Paul Widmer: Project supervision

The project was funded by the SNSF grant No. 100015L_182126/1.

      <li>NUM: tret, treve, dhe:ta, dyt, dyten, nodhe:ta, pa:r, pa:ri, tre:t, treten</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>


<ul>
  <li><a>Reflex</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Yes
    <ul>
      <li>AUX: u, u:, o</li>
      <li>PRON: vet, veti, tij, ti:j, ve:te, ti, ve:t, ve:ti, atina, mu</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>Person</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>1
    <ul>
      <li>AUX-Fin: kum, kom, jam, ki:sha:, ko:m, ku:m, pata</li>
      <li>PRON: m, une, mu, un, une:, um, u:ne, un:, ai, i</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: di, pash, besoj, di:, pa:sh, beso:j, muj, doket, kupto:va, kuptoj</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>2
    <ul>
      <li>AUX-Fin: ishte, ka, keni, ki</li>
      <li>PRON: ti, aj, ja, t</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: din, di, pa, ishe, japish, kalum, len, merre, mungon, the</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>3
    <ul>
      <li>AUX-Fin: ka, kan, u, osht, ishte, jan, kishte, o, jon, ke</li>
      <li>PRON: i, e, j, a, aj, ata, u, i:, ai, ai:</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: do, kalon, sheh, dha, vjen, erdh, kaloj, merr, pa, jep</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Other Features</h3>


<ul>
  <li><a>Foreign</a>
    <ul>
      <li>Yes
        <ul>
          <li>ADP: am, in, mit, ufm, vo, vom</li>
          <li>ADV: ebe, fertig, lot, wi:ter</li>
          <li>AUX: hend, isch</li>
          <li>CCONJ: a, und</li>
          <li>DET: a</li>
          <li>NOUN: birne, kappe, baum, belo:nig, bode, jungs, korbe, lichtung, ma, menschlikeit</li>
          <li>NUM: zwei</li>
          <li>PART: thanks</li>
          <li>PRON: ihm, er, sich, sini</li>
          <li>VERB: abecheit, gholfe, helfe:, inegfahre, pfeife, verteilt</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 1 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: jam.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 3 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: kam, jam, _.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Acc (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Dat (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom (297)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom-ADP(me) (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (79)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Acc (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Dat (13)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Nom (253)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Acc (10)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (144)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom-ADP(te)-ADP(te) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON (48)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Dat (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Nom (78)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>obj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--PRON (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Abl (5)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Acc (369)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Dat (17)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Gen (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom (86)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Nom-ADP(nga) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (45)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Acc (242)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Dat (71)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Nom (8)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Abl (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Acc (42)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--NOUN-Nom (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Acc (11)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Dat (4)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Abl (5)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Acc (234)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Acc-ADP(n) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Dat (15)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Nom (45)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON (26)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Acc (109)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Dat (26)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Nom (4)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>iobj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-Dat (17)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Acc (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Dat (142)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Acc (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf--PRON-Dat (4)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-Dat (11)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Acc (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--PRON-Dat (56)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>



<h3>Verbs with Reflexive Core Objects</h3>

<ul>
  <li>This corpus contains 1 lemmas that occur at least once with a reflexive core object (<a>obj</a> or <a>iobj</a>). Examples: shoh vet</li>
</ul>

<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 2 relation subtypes: <a>aux:part</a>, <a>nsubj:outer</a></li>
<li>The following 4 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>vocative</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>compound</a>, <a>goeswith</a></li>
</ul>
